commit.message:
[CMake] Set --gcov-executable to ${CTEST_COVERAGE_COMMAND} when calling gcovr

Important to ensure that, say, a build with gcc-14/g++-14 uses the
matching gcov-14 for collecting coverage information, otherwise it
fails.

commit.message:
[XrdCl] Stop Poller before TaskManager

In 37b75132821e5ac9e9e5644590b7ef1b958850f3, stopping the poller was
(possibly inadvertently) moved to happen after stopping the task
manager. However, if the task manager is stopped first, an event may
become ready for read/write after the task manager has already been
destroyed, which may cause a socket callback to try to reinitialize
the poller by calling Poller->Init() while Poller->Stop() is running
on another thread, which may cause a crash.

verification.payload:
tree 464c74721cb8daeee8b21ec479f7156626e9fde4
parent cca20aef2a4739e90e2227b786a52f4752b182a0
author Guilherme Amadio <amadio@cern.ch> 1708962486 +0100
committer Guilherme Amadio <amadio@cern.ch> 1709033207 +0100

[XrdCl] Stop Poller before TaskManager

In 37b75132821e5ac9e9e5644590b7ef1b958850f3, stopping the poller was
(possibly inadvertently) moved to happen after stopping the task
manager. However, if the task manager is stopped first, an event may
become ready for read/write after the task manager has already been
destroyed, which may cause a socket callback to try to reinitialize
the poller by calling Poller->Init() while Poller->Stop() is running
on another thread, which may cause a crash.

commit.message:
[XrdScitokens] Allow creation of superfolders for requested filescope

As required by WLCG token spec, allow the creation of superfolders if
a filepath is requested with a create or modify scope.

https://github.com/WLCG-AuthZ-WG/common-jwt-profile/blob/master/profile.md

Fixes: #2185

verification.payload:
tree 4840f689fe433d2c21334447d5f9ffeee0b2b590
parent e47303c8118cf6233b120b9c56d735ca46ea9c95
author Jyothish Thomas <jyothish.thomas@stfc.ac.uk> 1707486931 +0000
committer Guilherme Amadio <amadio@cern.ch> 1708938763 +0100

[XrdScitokens] Allow creation of superfolders for requested filescope

As required by WLCG token spec, allow the creation of superfolders if
a filepath is requested with a create or modify scope.

https://github.com/WLCG-AuthZ-WG/common-jwt-profile/blob/master/profile.md

Fixes: #2185

commit.message:
add stat permissions to create, modify and write

stat permissions are implicitly required for storage systems for create, modify  and delete operations. Currently tokens with purely create and modify permissions would fail with permission denied on stat on attempts to perform those operations

verification.payload:
tree 21962d0348e37ea519fd4c3dda94b816302c3dc4
parent 50c540afecb414b8cfea03badc9d376b8494c5d1
author Jo-stfc <71326101+Jo-stfc@users.noreply.github.com> 1707398864 +0000
committer Guilherme Amadio <amadio@cern.ch> 1708938762 +0100

add stat permissions to create, modify and write

stat permissions are implicitly required for storage systems for create, modify  and delete operations. Currently tokens with purely create and modify permissions would fail with permission denied on stat on attempts to perform those operations

commit.message:
If the token path is `/`, then use the restricted path.

This handles the case where the token path ends in `/`; because the
scitokens-cpp library normalizes the paths to not end with the '/'
character, the only case to handle is the root directory.

verification.payload:
tree b58fed7c38fef97a52f79add5595731cae74d8e0
parent aa87750f0aa05c4222945b99a97a109dcfb649fc
author Brian Bockelman <bbockelman@morgridge.org> 1707794485 -0600
committer Guilherme Amadio <amadio@cern.ch> 1708938762 +0100

If the token path is `/`, then use the restricted path.

This handles the case where the token path ends in `/`; because the
scitokens-cpp library normalizes the paths to not end with the '/'
character, the only case to handle is the root directory.

commit.message:
Only match ACLs on a full path match.

If there's an ACL for `/foo`, do not permit `/foobar` but do permit
`/foo/bar`.

verification.payload:
tree 341e5c63a33e099cbeef71375a734e5eea213eae
parent fd0f77274726e58b8d8b725df200eaa6715686a0
author Brian Bockelman <bbockelman@morgridge.org> 1706021933 -0600
committer Guilherme Amadio <amadio@cern.ch> 1708938762 +0100

Only match ACLs on a full path match.

If there's an ACL for `/foo`, do not permit `/foobar` but do permit
`/foo/bar`.

commit.message:
Attempt to use restricted paths even when scope is more generic

If a token has a broad scope and all the listed restricted paths
are more specific, then try to generate ACLs that include the
restricted paths.

Example: suppose we have a token with scope `storage.read:/` but
restricted paths `/foo` and `/bar`.  Currently, we will reject the
scope and give the token no permissions.  With this commit, we will
generate acls of `read:/foo` and `read:/bar`.  So, as long as the
access being attempted is within the restricted path, we can permit
it.

verification.payload:
tree ac1721ad262e1da25700f8ee40ec77292c925d8d
parent 609f065a91c029f982061d019c7820dc594f1a0e
author Brian Bockelman <bbockelman@morgridge.org> 1702648818 -0600
committer Guilherme Amadio <amadio@cern.ch> 1708938755 +0100

Attempt to use restricted paths even when scope is more generic

If a token has a broad scope and all the listed restricted paths
are more specific, then try to generate ACLs that include the
restricted paths.

Example: suppose we have a token with scope `storage.read:/` but
restricted paths `/foo` and `/bar`.  Currently, we will reject the
scope and give the token no permissions.  With this commit, we will
generate acls of `read:/foo` and `read:/bar`.  So, as long as the
access being attempted is within the restricted path, we can permit
it.

commit.message:
[RPM] Install the client as dependency of main RPM

In some cases, like when a server is configured for third-party
transfers, the server calls the client directly. Therefore, it
is a good idea to install both server and client when running
dnf install xrootd.

verification.payload:
tree 01bbcd4cf582ac1a19f1c1295ec1d8e1391d7b54
parent cf605fe1e6de1d19a2ba2292227251f70cd65ff0
author Guilherme Amadio <amadio@cern.ch> 1708691720 +0100
committer Guilherme Amadio <amadio@cern.ch> 1708691721 +0100

[RPM] Install the client as dependency of main RPM

In some cases, like when a server is configured for third-party
transfers, the server calls the client directly. Therefore, it
is a good idea to install both server and client when running
dnf install xrootd.
